channel.title: Client packets(frames)
channel.description:
Hello, I am trying to conduct a small experiment with client-server communications. I want to send packet 26 with some extra information(like an int or a byte or something like that) to the server, but whenever I do, it reads that it's packet 26, but the rest is not correct. This is what I get:
[08:56:06]Received Packet 26: 16128//This 16128 is what is returned when the server's stream.readInt() is called for the client written int 26. [08:56:06]Unhandled packet: packetID=175 [08:56:06]Unhandled packet: packetID=150 [08:56:08]Unhandled packet: packetID=218 [08:56:08]Unhandled packet: packetID=110 [08:56:09]Unhandled packet: packetID=110 [08:56:10]Unhandled packet: packetID=27 [08:56:14]Unhandled packet: packetID=129 [08:56:14]Unhandled packet: packetID=27 [08:56:18]Unhandled packet: packetID=16 [08:56:23]Unhandled packet: packetID=236 [08:56:29]Unhandled packet: packetID=162 [08:56:31]Unhandled packet: packetID=53 [08:56:32]Unhandled packet: packetID=108 [08:56:33]Unhandled packet: packetID=60 [08:56:34]Unhandled packet: packetID=110 [08:56:35]Unhandled packet: packetID=163
It's a fairly bare server(basically login and walking) so I don't have any of the other packets documented right now, but I was wondering if I was doing something wrong, or was missing something.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 01, 2009, 03:12:13 pm[/size][hr]Can anyone help me with this?

item.title: Client packets(frames)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hello, I am trying to conduct a small experiment with client-server communications. I want to send packet 26 with some extra information(like an int or a byte or something like that) to the server, but whenever I do, it reads that it’s packet 26, but the rest is not correct. This is what I get:

[08:56:06]Received Packet 26: 16128//This 16128 is what is returned when the server's stream.readInt() is called for the client written int 26. [08:56:06]Unhandled packet: packetID=175 [08:56:06]Unhandled packet: packetID=150 [08:56:08]Unhandled packet: packetID=218 [08:56:08]Unhandled packet: packetID=110 [08:56:09]Unhandled packet: packetID=110 [08:56:10]Unhandled packet: packetID=27 [08:56:14]Unhandled packet: packetID=129 [08:56:14]Unhandled packet: packetID=27 [08:56:18]Unhandled packet: packetID=16 [08:56:23]Unhandled packet: packetID=236 [08:56:29]Unhandled packet: packetID=162 [08:56:31]Unhandled packet: packetID=53 [08:56:32]Unhandled packet: packetID=108 [08:56:33]Unhandled packet: packetID=60 [08:56:34]Unhandled packet: packetID=110 [08:56:35]Unhandled packet: packetID=163

It’s a fairly bare server(basically login and walking) so I don’t have any of the other packets documented right now, but I was wondering if I was doing something wrong, or was missing something.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 01, 2009, 03:12:13 pm[/size][hr]Can anyone help me with this?
